dc:title: From Union Square to Rome Dorothy Day 1938, Chapter 2, pp. 18-27. Recounts her first childhood experiences of discovering God in the Bible, helping others, singing in church, meeting her first Catholic -- ". . .I was filled with lofty ambitions to be a saint, a natural striving, a thrilling recognition of the possibilities of spiritual adventure."
